abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rural Power Project for
            Philippines were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory; Global Environment Objective (GEO) outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was moderate; risk to GEO outcome was moderate; bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: line of credit operations, being
            demand-driven is essential, and this needs to be balanced
            with due diligence, demand-building, marketing, and upfront
            technical support; flexibility is crucial for credit lines
            and other facilities targeting rural electrification and
            renewable energy; effective coordination of different
            government and donor initiatives targeting the same issue is
            imperative; while designing off-grid electrification
            business models, it is advisable to think long and hard
            about sustainability up front, and remember that there are
            different ways of ensuring sustainability; solar
            Photovoltaic (PV) should be part of a balanced portfolio of
            decentralized electrification solutions.
